lg.head: 72-Leaf—
lg.l:
Sea-water, and all breathing
it, and all living below
't.

Forests at the bottom of the
sea—the branches and
leaves, the sea-lettuce,
the vast lichens, the
strange flowers and seeds,
the thick tangle, the
openings, and the pink turf,

Different colors, pale gray and
green, purple, white
and gold—the play of
light through the water,

Dumb swimmers there among
the rocks, coral, gluten,
grass, rushes—and the
aliment of the swimmers,

Vast sluggish existences
grazing there, suspended
or slowly crawling close
to the bottom,

The sperm whale at the
surface blowing air
and water, or disporting
with his flukes,

The leaden-eyed shark,
the walrus, the turtle,
the hairy sea-leopard,
and the sting-ray;

Passions there—wars, pursuits,
tribes—sight in those
ocean depths—breathing
that thick-breathing air,
as so many do,

In change thence to the sight here
and to the subtle air breathed
by beings like us who walk
this sphere,

The change onward from ours to that
of beings who walk other spheres
